thread.title: Reports: Coach Steve Spurrier to retire from SC football
thread.title_full: Reports: Coach Steve Spurrier to retire from SC football

title: Reports: Coach Steve Spurrier to retire from SC football
text:
Reports: Coach Steve Spurrier to retire from SC football (COLUMBIA, SC) Multiple reports are saying that South Carolina head coach Steve Spurrier is retiring. Post to Facebook Reports: Coach Steve Spurrier to retire from SC football (COLUMBIA, SC) Multiple reports are saying that South Carolina head coach Steve Spurrier is retiring.  //on.wbir.com/1LrwlbC   Join the Conversation To   Reports: Coach Steve Spurrier to retire from SC football WLTX-TV 9:50 p.m. EDT October 12, 2015 Reports Monday night indicated South Carolina coach Steve Spurrier planned to resign. (Photo: WLTX-TV) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
(COLUMBIA, SC) Multiple reports are saying that South Carolina head coach Steve Spurrier is retiring. 
"Sports Illustrated's" Thayer Evans first reported the news. Other outlets, including Gamecock Central.com, began reporting the news later. 
Spurrier, a Tri-Cities native, was hired in November 2004 to replace Lou Holtz. He led the team to a strong winning record and numerous bowl appearances. 
This year, however, the team has struggled. The Gamecocks are currently 2-4 on the season. After last season, Spurrier, nicknamed "the Ole Ball Coach," appeared to hint that he had some ambivalence about continuing on as the South Carolina coach. 
Spurrier made his strongest mark in college football as head of the Florida Gators, who he led to a national championship in the 1990s. Spurrier played quarterback for the Gators in the 1960s, winning a Heisman Trophy. 
He later played in the NFL, including as quarterback for the woebegone nascent Tampa Bay Buccaneers. 
More on this story as it develops. Read or Share this story: http://on.wbir.com/1LrwlbC TOP VIDEOS
